Package com.redis.foundation.mail

Class MailManager

java.lang.Object
com.redis.foundation.mail.MailManager
public class MailManager extends Object
The MailManager is responsible capturing messages and sending them to email recipients based on configuration settings. The class offers a flexible template approach to message generation via Freemarker Templates.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getCfgPropertyPrefix

      public String getCfgPropertyPrefix()
      Returns the configuration property prefix string.
      Returns:
      Property prefix string.

    • setCfgPropertyPrefix

      public void setCfgPropertyPrefix(String aPropertyPrefix)
      Assigns the configuration property prefix to the document data source.
      Parameters:
      aPropertyPrefix - Property prefix.

    • getCfgString

      public String getCfgString(String aSuffix)
      Convenience method that returns the value of an application manager configuration property using the concatenation of the property prefix and suffix values.
      Parameters:
      aSuffix - Property name suffix.
      Returns:
      Matching property value.

    • getCfgString

      public String getCfgString(String aSuffix, String aDefaultValue)
      Convenience method that returns the value of an application manager configuration property using the concatenation of the property prefix and suffix values. If the property is not found, then the default value parameter will be returned.
      Parameters:
      aSuffix - Property name suffix.
      aDefaultValue - Default value.
      Returns:
      Matching property value or the default value.

    • getCfgInteger

      public int getCfgInteger(String aSuffix, int aDefaultValue)
      Returns a typed value for the property name identified or the default value (if unmatched).
      Parameters:
      aSuffix - Property name suffix.
      aDefaultValue - Default value to return if property name is not matched.
      Returns:
      Value of the property.

    • isCfgStringTrue

      public boolean isCfgStringTrue(String aSuffix)
      Returns true if the application manager configuration property value evaluates to true.
      Parameters:
      aSuffix - Property name suffix.
      Returns:
      true or false

    • lookupFromAddress

      public String lookupFromAddress() throws FCException
      Performs a property lookup for the from address.
      Returns:
      Email address from property file.
      Throws:
      FCException - Property is undefined.

    • createRecipientList

      public ArrayList<String> createRecipientList(String anEmailAddress)
      Convenience method that assigns the recipient email address to an array list.
      Parameters:
      anEmailAddress - Single email address.
      Returns:
      Array list of email address strings.

    • createRecipientList

      public ArrayList<String> createRecipientList() throws FCException
      Convenience method that assigns the recipient email addresses defined in the application property file to an array list.
      Returns:
      Array list of email address strings.
      Throws:
      FCException - When missing properties are detected

    • createAttachmentList

      public ArrayList<String> createAttachmentList(String anAttachmentPathFileName)
      Convenience method that assigns a single attachment to an array list.
      Parameters:
      anAttachmentPathFileName - Attachment path file name.
      Returns:
      Array list of attachment path/file names.

    • schemaMailDocument

      public DataDoc schemaMailDocument()
      This method will create a mail data document with one item for a message description.
      Returns:
      Data document instance.

    • schemaServiceMailBag

      public DataDoc schemaServiceMailBag()
      This method will create a mail document of items suitable for capturing a table of messages that could describe the result of a batch operation like a connector service.
      Returns:
      Data document instance.

    • messageCount

      public int messageCount()
      Returns the number of messages previously stored in the internally managed table.
      Returns:
      Count of messages.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Empties the internally managed table of any messages.

    • addMessage

      public boolean addMessage(DataDoc aDoc)
      Adds the items contained within the data document to the internally managed data grid. Refer to schemaMailDocument and schemaServiceMailBag methods.
      Parameters:
      aDoc - Data bag instance.
      Returns:
      true if the message is valid and added. false otherwise.

    • addMessage

      public boolean addMessage(String anOperation, String aStatus, String aDescription, String aDetail)
      Adds the items contained within the data document to the internally managed table. Refer to schemaServiceMailBag method.
      Parameters:
      anOperation - Application defined operation string.
      aStatus - Status message of operation.
      aDescription - Description of the operation.
      aDetail - Details around the operation.
      Returns:
      true if the message is valid and added. false otherwise.

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage(String aSubject, String aMessage) throws IOException, FCException, javax.mail.MessagingException
      If the property "delivery_enabled" is true, then this method will deliver the subject and message via an email transport (e.g. SMTP).
      Parameters:
      aSubject - Message subject.
      aMessage - Message content.
      Throws:
      IOException - I/O related error condition.
      FCException - Missing configuration properties.
      javax.mail.MessagingException - Message subsystem error condition.

    • sendMessageTable

      public void sendMessageTable(String aSubject) throws IOException, FCException, javax.mail.MessagingException
      If the property "delivery_enabled" is true, then this method will deliver the subject and messages stored in the internal table via an email transport (e.g. SMTP).
      Parameters:
      aSubject - Message subject.
      Throws:
      IOException - I/O related error condition.
      FCException - Missing configuration properties.
      javax.mail.MessagingException - Message subsystem error condition.

    • sendMessageBag

      public void sendMessageBag(String aSubject, DataDoc aDoc) throws IOException, FCException, javax.mail.MessagingException
      If the property "delivery_enabled" is true, then this method will deliver the subject and data document via an email transport (e.g. SMTP).
      Parameters:
      aSubject - Message subject.
      aDoc - Data document instance of items.
      Throws:
      IOException - I/O related error condition.
      FCException - Missing configuration properties.
      javax.mail.MessagingException - Message subsystem error condition.

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage(String aFromAddress, ArrayList<String> aRecipientList, String aSubject, String aMessage, ArrayList<String> anAttachmentFiles) throws IOException, FCException, javax.mail.MessagingException
      If the property "delivery_enabled" is true, then this method will generate an email message that includes subject, message and attachments to the recipient list. You can use the convenience methods lookupFromAddress(), createRecipientList() and createAttachmentList() for parameter building assistance.
      Parameters:
      aFromAddress - Source email address.
      aRecipientList - List of recipient email addresses.
      aSubject - Subject of the email message.
      aMessage - Messsage.
      anAttachmentFiles - List of file attachments or null for none.
      Throws:
      IOException - I/O related error condition.
      FCException - Missing configuration properties.
      javax.mail.MessagingException - Message subsystem error condition.
      See Also:
      • JavaMail API Attachments
      • JavaMail API MIME Types
